inclusion.criterion: cohort or in the same hospitals
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: HPV vaccination trial Planned number of patients to be enrolled: 884
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Annual gynecological examination with a Pap-smear and a sampling for HPV testing is planned
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Women with abnormal Pap-smear or with High-Risk HPV (HR-HPV) infection will be referred to a colposcopist
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: In case of abnormalities at the colposcopy, a biopsy will be performed
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: If the biopsy is normal or shows a CIN1, the women will be referred for a new colposcopic examination 6 months later
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: If the biopsy shows CIN2 or more, treatment will be provided -LEEP or conisation, or hysterectomy, and the women will be referred for a new colposcopic examination 6 months later
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Pap-smears will be read by local pathologists in participating hospital
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Biopsies will be read by local pathologists in participating hospital
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: HPV tests will all be performed in the PHPT virological laboratory in Chiang Mai
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Descriptive statistics, univariate and multivariate analyses
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: HIV infected women, older than 18 years of age, followed in the PHPT cohort vaccination trial
inclusion.label: met

notes: The patient is a 37-year-old woman who came to the clinic for a routine Pap smear. The test revealed stage 1B of cervical cancer.
